title: Increase header navbar logo size and align with auth button

requirements.summary: Increase header logo height responsively while preserving SVG aspect ratio.
acceptanceCriteria: On viewport widths below the `sm` breakpoint, the rendered logo height is between 36px and 40px.
On desktop viewports, the rendered logo height is between 48px and 56px.
The logo uses `width: auto` (or equivalent) so the SVG is not stretched/squashed.

file_operations.description: Adjust the logo Tailwind sizing classes to meet the required responsive heights (36–40px below `sm`, 48–56px on desktop) while preserving aspect ratio via `w-auto` (and/or `aspect-auto`). Ensure the logo uses explicit height utilities (e.g., `h-9`/`h-10` and `sm:h-12`/`sm:h-14`) rather than relying on inherited line-height.

requirements.summary: Prevent container/padding constraints from shrinking the logo and keep it vertically aligned with the Login/Logout button.
acceptanceCriteria: The logo and the Login/Logout button are vertically centered relative to each other in the header (no noticeable baseline mismatch).
There is no additional padding/margin applied to the logo element that reduces its visible size relative to the specified height.

file_operations.description: Update the logo wrapper and image classes to avoid any default button padding/line-height effects (e.g., add `p-0`, `leading-none`, `shrink-0`, and make the `block`) and ensure the header row maintains `items-center` alignment between the left logo cluster and the right auth button cluster so the visual centers match.

requirements.summary: Ensure the header navbar logo uses only the SVG asset across all breakpoints.
acceptanceCriteria: The header logo `` source points to an SVG asset (not PNG/JPG).
No alternative raster logo source is used for the navbar logo across breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Confirm the header logo continues to reference the existing SVG asset as the single source of truth (keep the pointing to the SVG), and avoid adding any conditional rendering or breakpoints that swap in raster images.
